definition: thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely

sentences.english: On one continent, thousands of people line in square matrix, rushing ahead to kill.
sentences.chinese: 在一块大陆上，上万的人排成方阵，彼此冲杀。

sentences.english: When Ren crossed the bridge, he saw Xuande to the left and Yan Yan to the right, both charging toward him.
sentences.chinese: 过了金雁桥，见玄德军在左，严颜军在右，冲杀将来。

sentences.english: On one land, tens of thousands men ranked and rushed and killed.
sentences.chinese: 在一块大陆上，上万的人排成方阵，彼此冲杀。

definition: to make a surprise attack/to pounce on (an enemy)
to attack with a bladed weapon
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
